intro: Ouratea batesii, commonly known as the golden star tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its distinctive golden-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its appearance. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The tree can grow up to 10 meters tall and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in gardens.
